description:
In Cuba a "patient undergoes a rapid test, which allows specialists to learn in less than 30 minutes if people have been or not infected.

In case of testing positive for Covid-19, the real-time PCR test is also implemented, which has a very small margin of error, Duran said.

If patient is positive, 15 days after being admitted with treatment, and if he shows a favorable clinical progress, the real-time PCR test is repeated." after Apr. 3

description: "Cuba’s Minister of Internal Trade Betsy Díaz Velázquez and Minister of Transportation Eduardo Rodríguez announced April 9 that, starting on April 11, most public urban, rural, and intra-municipal transportation will be suspended and most commercial spaces will close down. Only authorized transportation will operate at 50 percent capacity for essential workers and people heading to health appointments or other emergency situations, while stores will only sell food and essential items."
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Cuba is creating a temporary technical workgroup in the Health Minister with participants from the Army, other ministers, and national scientific and farmaceutical institutions. UPDATE: The task-force group created on January 28 is now a Work Group of the Health Minister with members from several other ministers, announced on April 9.
type: New Task Force, Bureau or Administrative Configuration

description: "Cuban officials will begin distributing doses of PrevengHo-Vir, a Cuban-manufactured homeopathic remedy, to the elderly and other vulnerable populations as a way to combat the spread within the country. The drug “increases resistance, the body’s defenses against a certain virus,” according to Francisco Durán, who heads epidemiology at the Health Ministry." approx. between Apr.1-7
type_text: The government will distribute a drug to vulnerable populations
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Cuba is expanding the expiration date of medicine prescriptions so people don't have to go to the hospital to get a new prescription to buy their controlled medicines.
type_text: Cuba is expanding the expiration date of medicine prescriptions so people (mostly, elderly) don't have to go to the hospital to get a new prescription to buy their controlled medicines (regular and unrelated to COVID medicines).

description: Cuba will carry out the university admission process to the 2020-2021 academic year when the epidemiological situation of the country allows it. Admission exams will be held thirty days after activities resumption.
type_text: It is a change to Cuba's universities schedules - particularly the admission process.

description: Cuba is changing the academic calendar schedule to finish the 2019-2020 academic year and to proper start the 2020-2021 academic year.
type_text: It is a chance in the academic calendar - particularly, a reorganization of the calendar.

description: In Cuba "isolation for surveillance for 14 days will be applied to all travelers residing in the country in the institutions authorized by the Ministry of Public Health if they presents symptoms.This sanitary measure is of strict compliance after Mar. 20".

description:
In Cuba "The Pinar del Río government decreed quarantine for the El Canal People’s Council, in the municipality of Consolación del Sur, after learning of a new case of local transmission of the coronavirus that causes COVID-19. This is the first community in Cuba that is isolated due to the epidemic." after Apr. 1
UPDATE:  "Violating the sanitary provisions established in the middle of the epidemic of coronavirus, which causes COVID-19, constitutes a crime according to Chapter 5 of the current Penal Code" after Mar. 31

description: Cuba is enforcing that "only cuban resident are allowed to enter the country, with flexibility to ensure cooperation with some countries.Applies for 30 days." Additionally Cuba is "increasing staff capacity.". Half of the restaurants are being closed. Campings, hotels, cinemas and theatres are as well being closed. Implementation of strong social protection to avoid unemployment. All measures taken by the government but described in public media.
